pageContext.claim: “If I stood in front of 25,000 people, because you would say nobody's ever, in the history of politics, gotten the crowd [Inaudible]. OK, that's one thing. And we have thousands outside, you know, we go help people and have rallies, and you know, we'll have -- we'll fill up stadiums, 25,000 people and 30,000, 40,000, 50,000 people standing outside.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often exaggerates his size of crowds at his rallies. For example, Trump claimed 50,000 people were outside a rally in Houston because they couldn't get in, but the city’s police chief said the number was much lower: 3,000.
